body_content.explanation: the highest point reached by a heavenly body (= any object existing in space, especially a planet, or the sun) as it travels around, or appears to travel around, another body:
examples: The summer sun was at its zenith in a cloudless sky.
The sun is well past its zenith when we cross paths with a mini-flotilla.

body_content.explanation: the point in the sky directly above you:
examples: The centre of the map is the zenith (straight overhead).
A pall of cloud muffled the whole expanse of sky from zenith to horizon.

body_content.explanation: the best or most successful point or time:
examples: In the 1860s, Tolstoy was at the zenith of his achievement.
His career reached its zenith in the 1960s.
